name: Nature Conservancy of Canada
description: Planted 500 whitebark pine seedlings resistant to white pine blister rust in a 4 ha burned area (from 2014) on Mt. McGregor
project_type: Ecosystem Restoration/Enhancement/Remediation, Land Management, Species at Risk
habitat_type: Dry Forest, Deciduous & Mixed Coniferous Forest, Lake / River / Stream, Wetlands, Cottonwood / Riparian, Old Growth Forest, Wildlife Trees

name: Lake Windermere Rod and Gun Club
description: Replacement of waterfowl nesting boxes within Columbia Wetlands.
project_type: Ecosystem Restoration/Enhancement/Remediation

name: Lake Windermere Rod and Gun Club
description: Placement of nesting boxes traditional habitat lost due to wildfires or land development
project_type: Ecosystem Restoration/Enhancement/Remediation, Landowner, Outreach, Species at Risk

name: Regional District of East Kootenay
description: The NIPP aims to assist private land owners/occupiers in the Regional District of East Kootenay manage invasive plants on their property.  The program provides complimentary site visits, spray equipment loan out, support, guidance, resources and cash rebates for treatment work carried out.  A major component of the program is increasing landowner education and awareness levels of invasive plants and the threats they pose ecologically, economically and socially.
project_type: Ecosystem Restoration/Enhancement/Remediation, Education/Outreach, Invasive Species Control

name: Nature Conservancy of Canada
description: Removing culverts and bridges, deactivating and recontouring old logging roads.
project_type: Ecosystem Restoration/Enhancement/Remediation, Fish/Wildlife Conservation, Land Management
habitat_type: Dry Forest, Deciduous & Mixed Coniferous Forest, Grasslands, non-irrigated pasture lands & range

name: Lake Windermere Rod and Gun Club
description: Removal of stream barrier for fish use of upstream habitat.
project_type: Aquatic, Ecosystem Restoration/Enhancement/Remediation, Landowner Outreach

name: Lake Windermere Rod and Gun Club
description: Installation and monitoring of nesting boxes
project_type: Ecosystem Restoration/Enhancement/Remediation, Landowner Outreach, Species at Risk

name: Columbia Valley Greenways Trail Alliance
description: A 25 kilometer paved path from Invermere to Fairmont Hot Springs
project_type: Landscape Connectivity

name: Columbia Valley Greenways Trail Alliance
description: A 25 kilometer paved path from Invermere to Fairmont Hot Springs
project_type: Landscape Connectivity
habitat_type: Dry Forest, Deciduous & Mixed Coniferous Forest, Lake / River / Stream

name: Kootenay Community Bat Project
description: The KCBP Provides:  1) Outreach and education on bat conservation  2) Landowner visits to properties with bats   3) Promotion of bat houses  4) Annual Bat Count
project_type: Education/Outreach, Fish/Wildlife, Conservation Species at Risk
